channel.title: BBC News - Technology

item.title: AI narration of chef Anthony Bourdain's voice sparks row
item.description: A recreation of the late celebrity cook's voice is used in a film about his life.

item.title: Valve reveals handheld Steam Deck PC games console
item.description: Gaming giant Valve has produced a handheld console that can play popular PC games.

item.title: Finding 'Grace': Murder, DNA and ancestry
item.description: How a novel use of DNA and ancestry websites is helping police uncover clues in cold case murders.

item.title: Clippy returns - as an emoji
item.description: Microsoft changes its paperclip emoji to look like its early virtual assistant, the object of much affection and frustration.

item.title: Instagram admits moderation mistake over racist comments
item.description: The social-media platform said its technology had been erroneously identifying the comments as benign.

item.title: WhatsApp to let users message without their phones
item.description: For the first time, billions of people will be able to use the service even if their phone has no battery.

item.title: Cambridge data shows Bitcoin mining on the move
item.description: New analysis shows crypto-mining moving away from China, while Kazakhstan boomed.

item.title: Plans submitted for electric battery 'gigafactory' in Coventry
item.description: The plant at Coventry Airport could create 6,000 new jobs, those behind the plans say.

item.title: MPs call for complete reset of music streaming to ensure fair pay for artists
item.description: The music industry is weighted against artists, who see "pitiful returns" from streaming, MPs say.

item.title: NHS Covid app: Should it stay or should it go?
item.description: There is a clash over the future of the NHS tracing app, as many delete it - or ignore its alerts.

item.title: Microsoft announces Windows 365, a subscription cloud PC
item.description: Microsoft has announced a new cloud PC technology where users stream their PC to any device.

item.title: Robot helps people get dressed and other tech news
item.description: Romana Kreider looks at some of the best technology news stories of the week.

item.title: Duran Duran’s Invisible: 'Thrilled' with AI collaboration
item.description: Musician Nick Rhodes explains why artificial intelligence was key in making their new music video.

item.title: How MetaHuman Creator helped me create ‘Dana’
item.description: Realistic digital humans can be produced rapidly with the new software, Epic Games says.

item.title: Google boss Sundar Pichai on tax and his personal tech habits
item.description: Google boss Sundar Pichai defends company record on tax – and explains his personal tech habits.

item.title: Quadriplegic driver makes Goodwood Festival racing debut
item.description: Former IndyCar driver Sam Schmidt was paralysed from the shoulders down in a racing accident in 2000.

item.title: How your personal data is being scraped from social media
item.description: As hackers scoop up data from social media sites, should firms be taking better care of your data?

item.title: Should we trust big tech with our health data?
item.description: Our medical records are in demand by tech firms who want to use the data to help tackle illnesses.

item.title: How your driving might reveal early signs of Alzheimer's
item.description: Research shows how small changes in the way you drive could expose preclinical signs of disease.

item.title: Voice cloning of growing interest to actors and cybercriminals
item.description: Why voice cloning is not just a threat to actors but could benefit cybercriminals too.

item.title: How did my phone number end up for sale on a US database?
item.description: A journey of discovery into the somewhat opaque, if lucrative, world of contact selling

item.title: Tired of working from home? Put the office on wheels
item.description: How digital nomads get state-of-the-art connectivity while working on the road

item.title: How de-cluttering grew Facebook Marketplace to 1bn users
item.description: As Covid shut charity shops thrifty second-hand traders shifted online to bag a bargain, in droves.

item.title: Why are Chinese tech brands flocking to Euro 2020?
item.description: Four big Chinese firms have signed up to sponsor the European football tournament this year.

item.title: How to get a lucrative job in cybersecurity
item.description: There's a serious shortage of IT security workers, so recruiters are fishing in a bigger pool.
